lines.text: Flourish. Enter KING EDWARD IV, GLOUCESTER, CLARENCE,  and soldiers with QUEEN MARGARET, OXFORD, and SOMERSET, prisoners

lines.speaker: king edward the fourth
lines.text: Now here a period of tumultuous broils. Away with Oxford to Hames Castle straight: For Somerset, off with his guilty head. Go, bear them hence I will not hear them speak.

lines.speaker: oxford
lines.text: For my part, Ill not trouble thee with words.

lines.speaker: somerset
lines.text: Nor I, but stoop with patience to my fortune.
Exeunt Oxford and Somerset, guarded

lines.speaker: queen margaret
lines.text: So part we sadly in this troublous world, To meet with joy in sweet Jerusalem.

lines.speaker: king edward the fourth
lines.text: Is proclamation made, that who finds Edward Shall have a high reward, and he his life

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: It is: and lo, where youthful Edward comes!
Enter soldiers, with PRINCE EDWARD

lines.speaker: king edward the fourth
lines.text: Bring forth the gallant, let us hear him speak. What! can so young a thorn begin to prick Edward, what satisfaction canst thou make For bearing arms, for stirring up my subjects, And all the trouble thou hast turnd me to

lines.speaker: prince edward
lines.text: Speak like a subject, proud ambitious York! Suppose that I am now my fathers mouth Resign thy chair, and where I stand kneel thou, Whilst I propose the selfsame words to thee, Which traitor, thou wouldst have me answer to.

lines.speaker: queen margaret
lines.text: Ah, that thy father had been so resolved!

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: That you might still have worn the petticoat, And neer have stoln the breech from Lancaster.

lines.speaker: prince edward
lines.text: Let AEsop fable in a winters night His currish riddles sort not with this place.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: By heaven, brat, Ill plague ye for that word.

lines.speaker: queen margaret
lines.text: Ay, thou wast born to be a plague to men.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: For Gods sake, take away this captive scold.

lines.speaker: prince edward
lines.text: Nay, take away this scolding crookback rather.

lines.speaker: king edward the fourth
lines.text: Peace, wilful boy, or I will charm your tongue.

lines.speaker: clarence
lines.text: Untutord lad, thou art too malapert.

lines.speaker: prince edward
lines.text: I know my duty you are all undutiful: Lascivious Edward, and thou perjured George, And thou misshapen Dick, I tell ye all I am your better, traitors as ye are: And thou usurpst my fathers right and mine.

lines.speaker: king edward the fourth
lines.text: Take that, thou likeness of this railer here.
Stabs him

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Sprawlst thou take that, to end thy agony.
Stabs him

lines.speaker: clarence
lines.text: And theres for twitting me with perjury.
Stabs him

lines.speaker: queen margaret
lines.text: O, kill me too!

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Marry, and shall.
Offers to kill her

lines.speaker: king edward the fourth
lines.text: Hold, Richard, hold for we have done too much.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Why should she live, to fill the world with words

lines.speaker: king edward the fourth
lines.text: What, doth she swoon use means for her recovery.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Clarence, excuse me to the king my brother Ill hence to London on a serious matter: Ere ye come there, be sure to hear some news.

lines.speaker: clarence
lines.text: What what

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: The Tower, the Tower.
Exit

lines.speaker: queen margaret
lines.text: O Ned, sweet Ned! speak to thy mother, boy! Canst thou not speak O traitors! murderers! They that stabbd Caesar shed no blood at all, Did not offend, nor were not worthy blame, If this foul deed were by to equal it: He was a man this, in respect, a child: And men neer spend their fury on a child. Whats worse than murderer, that I may name it No, no, my heart will burst, and if I speak: And I will speak, that so my heart may burst. Butchers and villains! bloody cannibals! How sweet a plant have you untimely croppd! You have no children, butchers! if you had, The thought of them would have stirrd up remorse: But if you ever chance to have a child, Look in his youth to have him so cut off As, deathmen, you have rid this sweet young prince!

lines.speaker: king edward the fourth
lines.text: Away with her go, bear her hence perforce.

lines.speaker: queen margaret
lines.text: Nay, never bear me hence, dispatch me here, Here sheathe thy sword, Ill pardon thee my death: What, wilt thou not then, Clarence, do it thou.

lines.speaker: clarence
lines.text: By heaven, I will not do thee so much ease.

lines.speaker: queen margaret
lines.text: Good Clarence, do sweet Clarence, do thou do it.

lines.speaker: clarence
lines.text: Didst thou not hear me swear I would not do it

lines.speaker: queen margaret
lines.text: Ay, but thou usest to forswear thyself: Twas sin before, but now tis charity. What, wilt thou not Where is that devils butcher, Hardfavourd Richard Richard, where art thou Thou art not here: murder is thy almsdeed Petitioners for blood thou neer putst back.

lines.speaker: king edward the fourth
lines.text: Away, I say I charge ye, bear her hence.

lines.speaker: queen margaret
lines.text: So come to you and yours, as to this Prince!
Exit, led out forcibly

lines.speaker: king edward the fourth
lines.text: Wheres Richard gone

lines.speaker: clarence
lines.text: To London, all in post and, as I guess, To make a bloody supper in the Tower.

lines.speaker: king edward the fourth
lines.text: Hes sudden, if a thing comes in his head. Now march we hence: discharge the common sort With pay and thanks, and lets away to London And see our gentle queen how well she fares: By this, I hope, she hath a son for me.
Exeunt
